item.title: Mohammed bin Salman forged king’s sign on Yemen war decree: Ex-official
'Minorities in Bangladesh being forced to resign, threatened to leave country'
British tech giant Mike Lynch among missing after yacht sinks off Sicily
Republicans launch Biden impeachment report - without proof
Blinken: Bibi has agreed to mediators’ truce proposal
Harris super PAC founder says public polls are too optimistic
item.description: Chauncey McLean, president of Future Forward, revealed that their internal polling for Kamala Harris' presidential campaign is less optimistic than public surveys. McLean highlighted close races in key states and emphasized the importance of winning Pennsylvania, North Carolina, or Georgia for Harris to secure the presidency. Public desires for detailed policy positions from Harris were also noted.

item.title: Hasina's minister arrested; 2 more murder cases against deposed PM
'If elected would offer Elon Musk Cabinet role or ... ': Trump
item.description: During a campaign stop, Donald Trump suggested Elon Musk for a key role in his potential future administration. He praised Musk's intelligence, describing him as a 'brilliant guy.' Earlier, the two discussed creating a government efficiency commission. However, Trump's plan to dismantle Biden's EV policies might pose challenges for Tesla, Musk's company.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: All you need to know about DNC: Schedule, speakers and themes
item.description: The Democratic Party convention in Chicago saw Vice-President Kamala Harris accept the presidential nomination, following President Biden's decision not to seek reelection. Minnesota Governor Tim Walz was named as her running mate. Prominent speakers included Barack Obama and Bill Clinton. Key policy proposals focused on economic reforms, healthcare and reproductive rights, aiming to portray a progressive vision for the future.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Genocide Joe' chants ring out as protesters breach DNC security
item.description: Protesters breached a police-secured fence near the Democratic National Convention site in Chicago, voicing opposition to the Gaza war. Although some disturbances occurred, the inner security perimeter remained intact. As President Biden toured the venue, activists demanded an end to US aid to Israel, echoing sentiments from the 1968 protests against the Vietnam War.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Tim Walz got married on anniversary of Tiananmen Square, GOP senator asks
item.description: Tim Walz married Gwen on June 4, 1994 -- the fifth anniversary of the uprising in China's Tiananmen Square. Gwen at that time said Tim Walz wanted a date that he would always remember. Tim Walz spent a year in the Far East in 1989 when he taught English and American history and culture in Foshan, Guangdong province, as part of the WorldTeach program learning Mandarin. Tim also went to China for his honeymoon.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Conservative former judger 'unhesitatingly' endorses Kamala Harris, calls Trump 'singularly unfit'
item.description: Conservative former judge J Michael Luttig Monday endorsed Kamala Harris and said former president Donald Trump is a threat to democracy. He said his political differences with Kamala Harris' party does not matter as far as this election is concerned because Donald Trump is "singularly unfit". In a statement, accessed by the CNN, Luttig, a veteran of two Republican administrations, wrote that there is only one candidate this election who can claim the mantle of defender and protector of America's democracy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pro-Israel John Fetterman skips DNC; his staff takes 'might makes rights' jibe
item.description: Senator John Fetterman known for his pro-Israel stance keeps his distance from the Democratic National Convention saving the party from any conflict on the Israel-Hamas issue but in an interview with the Free Press, the Democratic leader said his absence from the DNC has nothing to with his stand on Israel. Meanwhile, his communications director whose job is to represent him said she does not agree with her boss on the issue of Israel-Gaza.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Migrant workers on Scottish fishing boats ‘treated as slaves’
item.dc:creator: Naomi Canton

item.title: Why Joe Biden, Jill will skip Kamala Harris, Barack Obama's speeches at DNC
item.description: Joe Biden will deliver his political swan song tonight at the Democratic National Convention as Kamala Harris will accept the presidential nomination in Chicago but the Bidens will not stay put at Chicago to attend Kamala Harris' event scheduled on Thursday. They will fly to California for a six-day vacation and they will not be there to attend former president Barack Obama's speech at the convention either.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris criticized for 'Democracy is...' remark; 'They took her off teleprompter'
item.description: Vice president Kamala Harris' statement on the duality of democracy is the latest flashpoint between the Dem and the GOP as the Republicans called Harris' statement the latest example of "word salad". Harris in her statement said democracy is both "incredibly strong" and "incredibly fragile". Republicans said Harris was off the teleprompter and hence dished a word salad.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'F**k you!': Biden's friend shuts down ex-Obama aide ahead of DNC
item.description: ​"Isn't it great that f--king guy finally figured out he had to quit?" the ex-Obama aide said. Barnicle did not follow and asked, "What guy?!' After learning that it was Joe Biden the ex-Obama aide was talking about, Barnicle said, "You know something? F***k you! And f***k all your friends with their anonymous quotes in the papers. Put your name on it next time!"
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US presidential elections: Crunch time in Chicago as Democrats and MAGA duke it out over Doritos
item.description: Democrats gathered in Chicago for a four-day event to build momentum for Kamala Harris, the presidential nominee. Outgoing President Biden spoke first, followed by other party notables. Despite leading in polls, Harris faces challenges, including attacks from white nationalists and accusations. Microsoft's AI warning highlights the growing influence of AI-generated disinformation in the election.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Who is 'British Bill Gates' Mike Lynch missing in Bayesian yacht sinking off Sicily?
item.description: Tech entrepreneur Mike Lynch who is called the British Bill Gates went missing after the Bayesian superyacht with 22 people on board -- including two Americans and a Canadian -- sank off the coast in Sicily during a violent storm Monday. Lynch co-founded Autonomy, a software firm that pioneered in the UK tech scene, in the mid-90s.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Set up by Hasina, Bangladesh war crimes tribunal to now probe her
item.description: Under Hasina's rule, the ICT sentenced more than 100 people to death, including several of her political opponents. The ICT has been criticized by rights groups for not adhering to international conventions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
